personalInfo.splInterest: Watching movies, ping-pong, spending time with family

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2015 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished the Web.com Tour season having played all 25 events. Had a third-place finish, three top-10s, five top-25s and made 15 cuts. Finished 44th on the combined final money list...In just his second Web.com Tour start as a member, finished T3 at the Colombia Championship in February on the strength of a 66-65 finish, missing the playoff between winner Patrick Rodgers, his former Stanford U. teammate, and Steve Marino by two shots...In April, started the final round of the El Bosque Mexico Championship T39 but quickly jumped up the leaderboard with a front-nine 32. Added four more birdies and a bogey on the back nine for a round of 65 and a T8 to get to 17th in earnings...From May on played 14 events, adding two more top 25s, a T18 at the Stonebrae Championship, near Stanford, in July and a T19 at the Air Capital Classic in June...Would finish the Regular Season 50th on the money list and No. 1 in Sand Save Percentage (67.74). Played in all 21 Regular Season events. Led the Regular Season in Sand Save Percentage (67.74%)...In the Web.com Tour Finals, recorded a T9 at the Small Business Connection Championship. Was within two of the lead after completing the front nine on Sunday but a double-bogey at No. 10 ruined his run. Only other cut made in the Finals was a T56 at the Web.com Tour Championship. Finished $2,579 behind Rob Oppenheim, who snared the last Finals' card available.
tourBios.carHigh:
Has played on the eGolf Tour and Gateway Tour. 

2014: Finished T16 at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December. Shot four rounds of 71 and two 67s...Won on the eGolf Tour, capturing the Willow Creek Open and the eGolf Tour Championship at Willow Creek...Also won the Tacoma Open in Washington.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: While attending Stanford, was 2013 Pac-12 Scholar Athlete of the Year and a 2013 Byron Nelson Award finalist. Named a 2012 and 2013 All-American Scholar. Was a 2012 second-team All-American, 2012 first-team All-Pac 12, 2011 first-team All-American, 2011 first-team All-Pac 12 and 2010 Honorable Mention All-Pac-12. Finished Stanford career with two victories (both in senior year) and the third-lowest scoring average (71.5) in school history behind Tiger Woods and Patrick Rodgers. Missed the 2012 fall tournaments to try and qualify for the PGA TOUR...Won 2010 Dogwood Invitational in Atlanta, which included a second-round 62...Was a four-time Junior All-American on the AJGA Tour...Was runner-up in the 2007 Arizona Amateur and 2007 Arizona Public Links Championship...Played on four state championship teams in high school at Hamilton High School in Chandler, Ariz.
tourBios.personal: Has two older sisters, Anna and Christy...Attended Bellarmine Prep in Tacoma, Wash., in 2005-06 and Hamilton High School in Arizona in 2006-09...Earliest memory in golf was beating dad at age 11...If not a golfer would teach/coach kids...Was next-door neighbors with Michael and Andrew Putnam for about six or seven years while growing up very near what is now Chambers Bay in the Seattle area...First broke 70 at age 11 at the Washington state championship, playing in the 8-11 division. Shot 67 (red tees)...Favorite courses played are Friar's Head and Augusta National...Favorite teams are the Seattle Seahawks, the Phoenix Suns and all Stanford teams...Favorite TV shows are "Friends" and "How I Met Your Mother."...Favorite movie is "Rush Hour 2"...Favorite entertainers are Boyz II Men and Jabbawockeez...Favorite book is the Bible...Favorite athlete is Roger Federer...Most famous people he has met are Condoleeza Rice and Tiger Woods...Would like to trade places with Barack Obama for a day "to see what it's like to be President."...Dream foursome would include his dad, Ben Hogan and Woods...Originally was lefthanded...Would like to visit New Zealand, Machu Picchu and skydive...Speaks Korean...Likes to do impersonations...First-tee intro song would be "Ice Ice Baby" by Vanilla Ice.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T3rd in 2015 at the Colombia Championship Presented by Claro.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 48th in Heat Index(Money)-last 4 evts on the Web.com Tour.
